intro: Cyphostemma jaegeri, commonly known as the Desert Trumpet, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, woody fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and can store water in its stems to survive drought conditions. Cyphostemma jaegeri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
